title: Reset passwords for affected accounts
summary: User must change passwords for accounts that may have been exposed
steps: Use a clean device;Change password to unique strong password;Do not reuse passwords across services;Enable 2FA if available
notes: Recommend password manager for long term

title: Enable MFA / 2FA on all critical accounts
summary: Add a second auth factor to prevent takeover
steps: Enable TOTP (Authenticator app) or hardware key;Avoid SMS if possible;Store recovery codes securely

title: Rotate API keys and tokens
summary: Any API keys, service tokens exposed should be rotated immediately
steps: Revoke exposed keys;Issue new keys;Update services to use new keys;Audit usage logs for misuse

title: Revoke connected third-party OAuth apps
summary: Connected apps may have access — revoke and re-grant with caution
steps: Review OAuth apps list on affected accounts;Revoke suspicious/unused apps;Re-authorize only required apps

title: Monitor for credential stuffing and suspicious login attempts
summary: Watch for reuse of leaked credentials elsewhere
steps: Enable login anomaly detection;Throttle or block repeated failed logins;Force password resets on suspicious accounts

title: Sign up for breach monitoring / Pwned lookups
summary: Add email/username to monitoring services
steps: Register emails with breach-alert services;Subscribe to notify if reappear in dumps
notes: Use both free and paid services for coverage

title: Send user notification + guidance template
summary: Notify affected users with clear remediation steps
steps: Prepare template explaining exposure & required actions;Provide step-by-step reset & 2FA enable instructions;Include contact support link
notes: Avoid revealing sensitive forensic details in user notification

title: Apply password complexity & rotation policies (org-wide)
summary: Enforce strong password rules and periodic rotations for critical accounts
steps: Set minimum length;Disallow common passwords;Force rotation per policy

title: Enable Account Activity / Session listing
summary: Provide users ability to review and terminate active sessions
steps: Implement session list in account settings;Allow remote session kill;Shorten session lifetime for sensitive apps
notes: Must also set HttpOnly and Secure cookie flags

title: Implement rate-limiting and bot protections
summary: Prevent automated abuse from leaked credentials
steps: Add rate-limits by IP and account;Add CAPTCHAs after suspicious activity;Block TOR/proxy if policy requires

title: Scan for credential reuse across internal systems
summary: Users often reuse passwords — check internal systems
steps: Search internal user stores for same hashes/salts;Force rotation on matches;Notify owners
notes: Ensure secure handling of password data

title: Update Password Storage Practices
summary: Ensure strong hashing and salts for stored passwords
steps: Use Argon2/Bcrypt/PBKDF2;Add pepper where possible;Audit password handling code/workflows
notes: If legacy storage found, plan migration

title: Deploy phishing awareness and simulated phishing send
summary: Educate users to avoid follow-up phishing attempts after leak
steps: Schedule user training;Run simulated phishing tests;Provide reporting button

title: Block leaked account IPs/regions temporarily
summary: If abuse is from specific IPs/regions, apply temporary blocking
steps: Identify abusive IPs;Create firewall rules or WAF blocks;Monitor collateral impact
notes: Use carefully to avoid disrupting legitimate users

title: Audit 3rd-party services & password sharing in teams
summary: Check if team members shared credentials with external services
steps: Enumerate integrations;Revoke unnecessary service access;Force team password refresh
notes: Prefer per-service credentials rather than shared accounts

title: Prepare a post-incident FAQ and timeline
summary: Clear communication reduces user panic
steps: Draft FAQ with steps taken;Publish timeline of incident handling;Provide contact for affected users

title: Engage legal / compliance if PII or regulated data involved
summary: Certain leaked data triggers legal obligations
steps: Consult counsel;Notify regulators if required by law;Keep records of mitigation steps

title: Add affected emails to monitoring watchlist
summary: Keep a persistent watch for listed email addresses
steps: Add to internal watchlist;Subscribe to external breach alerts;Record first-seen timestamp

title: Advise users to check for phishing attempts
summary: Phishers may target leaked emails
steps: Do not click unknown links;Verify senders;Verify login pages carefully

title: Encourage email providers to enable SPF/DKIM/DMARC
summary: If email domain is owned by the org, harden email delivery
steps: Check SPF & DKIM;Add DMARC policy;Monitor reports

title: Blacklist exposed emails from admin-only lists
summary: Prevent exposed addresses from being used for admin actions
steps: Add to block/verification list;Require re-validation for privileged actions
notes: Helps prevent attackers using leaked email to self-enroll

title: Suggest users enable compromised-account checks on services
summary: Direct users to built-in provider checks (Google, Microsoft) for compromised accounts
steps: Provide links to provider account check pages;Change password;Review recent activity

title: Offer complimentary identity monitoring (if possible)
summary: For high-risk exposures, offer monitoring/credits
steps: Provide sign-up instructions;Explain limits and scope

title: Search internal ticketing/CRM for exposed emails
summary: Prevent attacker use of exposed emails for social engineering internally
steps: Cross-reference exposed emails with CRM entries;Flag accounts for extra verification;Retrain agents on verification policies
notes: Add automated alert rule for flagged emails

title: Instruct user to wipe browser autofill & saved passwords
summary: Autofill leaks include stored form-values and possibly saved passwords/CCs
steps: On a clean device: open browser settings;Remove saved passwords, addresses, credit cards;Clear autofill form data;Re-login and rotate creds

title: Revoke & reissue browser-saved payment tokens
summary: Saved payment methods could be used for purchases
steps: Remove saved cards from browser;Contact bank to re-issue tokens if needed;Monitor card statements
notes: If card was exposed, treat as potential fraud

title: Force logout & revoke sessions
summary: Cookies/autofill often let attackers resume sessions
steps: Expire session tokens server-side;Force all devices to re-authenticate;Invalidate persistent login tokens
notes: Coordinate with cookie invalidation on server

title: Advise re-issuing any credentials stored in browser (passwords, passkeys)
summary: If passwords were saved and leaked, they must be changed
steps: Identify accounts stored as autofill;Use clean device to change password;Enable 2FA
notes: Provide user help with listing saved credentials

title: Scan endpoint for credential-stealing malware
summary: Autofill leaks often come from malware or compromised machine
steps: Isolate the machine;Run full AV/EDR scan;Consider offline forensic image;Rebuild OS if compromise confirmed
notes: If rootkits found, rebuild the machine

title: Advise users to remove browser extensions and audit them
summary: Malicious or vulnerable extensions can exfiltrate autofill data
steps: List installed extensions;Remove untrusted ones;Reinstall only from official stores

title: Change Payment/Bank details if autofill included card numbers
summary: If card numbers are in autofills, treat as financial compromise
steps: Contact bank to cancel/monitor card;Update payment methods;File fraud claims if needed

title: Rotate server-side session secrets and invalidate cookies
summary: Cookies may contain session tokens — rotate server secrets to invalidate stolen cookies
steps: Rotate session signing secrets;Increment server-side session version to force logout;Shorten cookie lifetime temporarily

title: Set cookie flags to secure, HttpOnly, SameSite and reduce lifetimes
summary: Harden cookie attributes to reduce future risk
steps: Add HttpOnly and Secure flags;Use SameSite=strict or lax;Reduce session TTL for important users
notes: Also consider encrypted cookies if not used

title: Force re-authentication for high-risk operations
summary: Even if session exists, require password or MFA for sensitive changes
steps: Add step-up auth when users change email/password or transfer funds

title: Audit server logs for token reuse from remote IPs
summary: Detect abuse by searching for token reuse or strange session activity
steps: Query auth logs for same session token from multiple IPs;Block suspicious IPs;Notify users of session anomaly
notes: Use SIEM/Kibana queries for quick detection

title: Invalidate Remember-Me cookies and persistent tokens
summary: Persistent login tokens often survive cookie rotation
steps: Revoke persistent tokens in DB;Expire cookies on client;Force fresh login
notes: Ensure DB schema supports token revocation

title: Shorten cookie lifetime and refresh policy temporarily
summary: Reduce time-window for stolen cookies to be useful
steps: Set session TTL to short window;Monitor login load;Revert to normal TTL after stabilization
notes: Watch for user complaints about re-login frequency

title: Force password reset for exposed accounts only
summary: If log file only contains username/passwords, require password change
steps: Force reset on next login;Invalidate active sessions;Notify user with steps
notes: Do not include password in email

title: Check for credential reuse on high-privilege accounts
summary: If same creds used for admin services, immediate rotation needed
steps: Identify reused passwords in privileged accounts;Rotate immediately;Audit access logs for suspicious actions

title: Require immediate MFA setup for accounts previously without it
summary: Add protection to accounts that had only password auth
steps: Notify user to set up TOTP/hardware key;Temporarily limit high-risk actions until MFA enabled
notes: Consider grace period with support help

title: Search for lateral movement using leaked creds
summary: Attackers may try leaked credentials to pivot inside networks
steps: Check SSH/RDP logs and sudo logs;Check remote access logs for unusual times/IPs;Block compromised endpoints
notes: If evidence found, isolate affected systems

title: Rotate service/automation account credentials
summary: Leaked human creds sometimes used to access service accounts
steps: Rotate keys used by CI/CD and backend services that may have used the same password;Audit automated workflows

title: Isolate compromised machine from network
summary: Stop further exfiltration or lateral movement
steps: Physically unplug or disable NIC;Block device IP/MAC at network level;Start forensic collection
notes: Use imaging before running AV if doing deep analysis

title: Create forensic image and preserve chain of custody
summary: If you suspect targeted compromise, preserve evidence
steps: Image disk (bit-for-bit);Hash and store image;Document chain of custody
notes: Important for legal or IR processes

title: Collect browser artifacts (history, extensions, cookies, LocalStorage)
summary: Browser artifacts provide exfiltration evidence
steps: Pull browser profile files;Export cookie/localStorage files;Note installed extensions and timestamps

title: Rotate local machine and Windows domain credentials
summary: If machine shows signs of compromise, local accounts may be used
steps: Change local admin and AD passwords from safe machine;Rotate RDP certificates if used

title: Check scheduled tasks, autoruns, startup items
summary: Malware often persists via startup entries
steps: Inspect Task Scheduler/cron jobs;Review registry Run keys (Windows);Check /etc/rc*.d on Linux

title: Implement server-side session revocation list
summary: Ability to revoke sessions centrally speeds incident response
steps: Add session revocation table keyed by session id;Check revocation on each request;Provide admin UI to revoke sessions
notes: Reduces need to rotate global secrets

title: Add anomaly detection on auth events (device/IP mismatch)
summary: Detect token reuse by correlating device fingerprints
steps: Record device/user-agent/IP/time;Flag session tokens used from different geos quickly;Force re-auth if anomaly

title: Log minimal PII in server logs and mask secrets
summary: Avoid storing full tokens/passwords in logs
steps: Redact sensitive fields;Hash identifiers when possible;Rotate logging keys
